Class GameHandle

  • java.lang.Object
    • GameHandle

  • public class GameHandle
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is used to handle all the threads like a Thread Pool. It is able to launch a thread with 4 player, close a thread by specifying his GameThread. The Players list and it's initialization are inside this class
    See Also:
    GameThread

      The construction of the GameHandle

      • addPlayer

        public void addPlayer(io.netty.channel.Channel channel)
        This method is used to add a player to the list of players by specifying an associated channel.
        Parameters:
        channel - Channel associated to the connected players
        See Also:
        Channel, JCoinchePlayer

      • getGameThreads

        public java.util.ArrayList<GameThread> getGameThreads()
        This method return the list of the Launched Game Thread
        Returns:
        GameThread
        See Also:
        GameThread

      • getPlayerByChannel

        public JCoinchePlayer getPlayerByChannel(io.netty.channel.Channel channel)
        This method is used to retreive a JCoinchePlayer by specifying his associated channel. It is oftenly used at the connection/disconnection of the client.
        Parameters:
        channel - The channel to retrieve player from
        Returns:
        JCoinchePlayer
        See Also:
        Channel, JCoinchePlayer

      • getPlayers

        public java.util.ArrayList<JCoinchePlayer> getPlayers()
        This method return the JCoinchePlayer List.
        See Also:

      • getPlayersCount

        public int getPlayersCount()
        This method return the with-channel players count.
        Returns:
        int
        See Also:
        JCoinchePlayer

      • handleGames

        public void handleGames()
        This method is called when a client is connected to the server to check if it is needed to start a game with the new clients. It is also calling startGame if four players are idle.
        See Also:
        startGame(ArrayList)

      • handleRemainingsClients

        public void handleRemainingsClients()
        This method is used to check at the clients disconnection to know if there is enough waiting clients to start a game (4).
        See Also:
        startGame(ArrayList), countWaitingClients(), GameThread

      • removeInnactiveChannels

        public void removeInnactiveChannels()
        This method is used to remove all the non-channel client from the list.
        See Also:
        ArrayList, JCoinchePlayer

      • setPlayers

        public GameHandle setPlayers(java.util.ArrayList<JCoinchePlayer> players)
        This method is setting the player list to the object
        Parameters:
        players - The players array to set/
        Returns:
        this
        See Also:
        ArrayList, JCoinchePlayer

      • startGame

        public void startGame(java.util.ArrayList<JCoinchePlayer> players)
        This method is starting a game by specifying an ArrayList of 4 players. A Thread is start and added to the threads ArrayList
        See Also:
        ArrayList, GameThread, Thread

      • stopGame

        public void stopGame(GameThread gameThread)
        This method stop a thread by specifying his GameThread and close all concerned clients. It is also sending a protocol GAME_STOPPED Message
        Parameters:
        gameThread - The GameThread to stop
        See Also:
        GameThread, MessageForger
